unnormalised: Did you know that a pinch of salt is actually about 1/8 tsp? My nani always said, “add a pinch of salt,” but never really quantified it! A recent study showed most home cooks underestimate this. Also, many recipes online call for 200 g of flour, but how many of us actually measure? I usually just eyeball it to roughly 1 cup.

unnormalised: Turns out, accuracy matters, especially in baking! I was trying to make gulab jamun, and the recipe called for 100 ml of milk. I ended up adding maybe 1/2 cup (which is actually closer to 120 ml!), and the dough was way too sticky. It affected the taste and texture - totally inedible!
normalised: Turns out, accuracy matters, especially in baking! I was trying to make gulab jamun, and the recipe called for one hundred milliliter of milk. I ended up adding maybe half cup (which is actually closer to one hundred and twenty milliliter!), and the dough was way too sticky. It affected the taste and texture - totally inedible!

unnormalised: Moral of the story? Invest in some measuring spoons and cups, or even a kitchen scale. A little precision, like knowing 1 tbsp is about 15 ml, can save you from culinary disasters! Happy cooking, folks!
